meanings.sent1: She felt unluckier than ever when her ice cream fell on the ground.
meanings.sent2: He always seemed to be the unluckier one in their group of friends.
meanings.sent3: Despite feeling unluckier than a black cat, she kept a positive attitude.
meanings.sent4: The unluckier it got, the more she appreciated the little moments of joy.
meanings.sent5: The stormy weather made her feel even unluckier than before.

meanings.definition: More unfortunate than someone or something else
meanings.sent1: She was unluckier than her sister when it came to winning contests.
meanings.sent2: Out of all the players, he was the unluckier one in that game.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he must be unluckier than a four-leaf clover.
meanings.sent4: The unluckier team fought hard until the very end of the match.
meanings.sent5: The unluckier choice turned out to be the best decision in the long run.
